Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 3rd overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1967...
Had first career hit on 5/11/1971, off Gene Brabender (HOU)...
Earned first career win on 4/8/1972...
Hit first career homerun on 8/14/1972, off Pete Richert (LA)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/10/1973, winning 2 games with a 1.06 ERA...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Chicago (N) in 1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1977, winning 2 games with a 1.17 ERA...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1980, winning 2 games with a 0.50 ERA...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Traded from Chicago (N) to New York (A) on 1/31/1981 (Going to CHC: P M. Walters. Going to NYY: P J. Matlack)...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 5/1/1983, going 2-1, 1.13...
Signed as a free agent by Baltimore on 2/7/1986 to a 2-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
